pydexpi.pid_development.rule_manager module

class pydexpi.pid_development.rule_manager.AddPsvRule[source]

Bases: Rule

Install safety valves for all tanks of pressure greater than 3 psig (see docs/rules/add-psv-rule.svg) -> Add a PSV node to container with the design pressure above 3psig

apply(graph: DiGraph)[source]
class pydexpi.pid_development.rule_manager.CheckValveRule[source]

Bases: Rule

Install a check valve on a pump’s discharge part (see docs/rules/check-valve-rule.svg) -> Add a check valve node after the pump

apply(graph: DiGraph)[source]
class pydexpi.pid_development.rule_manager.CvPositionRule[source]

Bases: Rule

Do not install a control valve before a pump, add it after the pump (see docs/rules/cv-position-rule.svg) -> Remove a CV node before the pump and add after the pump if there is no CV after the pump

apply(graph: DiGraph)[source]
class pydexpi.pid_development.rule_manager.PsvInletRule[source]

Bases: Rule

Do not connect process pipes to a safety valve inlet pipe (see docs/rules/psv-inlet-rule.svg) -> Remove Tee node, the predecessor of PSV

apply(graph: DiGraph)[source]
class pydexpi.pid_development.rule_manager.ReactorTIRule[source]

Bases: Rule

Install a temperature instrument for a reactor (see docs/rules/reactor-ti-rule.svg) -> Add a TI node for reactor node

apply(graph: DiGraph)[source]
class pydexpi.pid_development.rule_manager.Rule[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for Rule implementation.

abstract apply(graph: DiGraph)[source]
class pydexpi.pid_development.rule_manager.RuleManager[source]

Bases: object

Class to manage the rules for autocorrection of P&IDs.

rules(list)
Type:

List of rules that the manager should apply.

add_rule: add a rule to be applied. Here, the order in which the rules

are added matters.

apply_rules: Apply all added rules to the given graph.

## Example usage:

## Create an initial graph initial_graph = nx.Graph() initial_graph.add_node(“A”)

## Initialize the chemical process graph with the initial graph chemical_graph = Graph_Loader(plant_graph=initial_graph)

## Manage and apply rules rule_manager = RuleManager() rule_manager.add_rule(ReactorTIRule()) rule_manager.add_rule(PsvInletRule())

## Apply the rules to the graph in the defined order rule_manager.apply_rules(chemical_graph)

## Print the resulting graph print(chemical_graph)

add_rule(rule: Rule)[source]
apply_rules(graph: DiGraph)[source]
